function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate safety measures in social spaces leading to disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of information dissemination for prevention measures and safety procedures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underutilized public spaces leading to a lack of essential services and support for essential sectors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of community disease transmission due to shared facilities in public places","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of the disease through shared facilities and units","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on essential urban systems and primary services","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Closure of non-essential public places","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary closure of secondary public places","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Provision of community-level designated zones","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Temporary regulations in public places","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Insufficient adaptation of public places for pandemic outbreaks","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Underestimation of the importance of public places in pandemic management","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to adaptive measures due to privacy concerns","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Content downloaded from unverified source","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unverified terms and conditions","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through shared article downloads and access to online library resources","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for the spread of contagious diseases in struggling economies and highly infected countries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of multiple sectors to the impacts of contagious diseases","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in architecture, civil engineering, and urbanism practices due to contagious diseases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on health in the built environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to adapt to new regulations and guidelines","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate disaster and emergency management practices","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Divergence in opinions of different groups of experts","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Convergence without consensus","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of the expert-led approach for selection and identification","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Survey participants with less than 3 years of experience may lack the necessary expertise to provide accurate and reliable opinions and suggestions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent opinions and suggestions due to varying levels of experience among the participants","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of bias towards the opinions and suggestions of participants with longer experience, leading to the neglect of valuable input from less experienced participants","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"People gathering in groups to participate in questionnaire","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accumulated weighting analysis process involving 25 participants from each field","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Involving a large number of individuals in the decision-making process may increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases, especially during in-person meetings or consultations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of likert rating system involving 25 participants may increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases if gathering in person","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Participant engagement conducted online may introduce bias in the selection and recommendation stages","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid development in the sectors of construction and the built environment may lead to inadequate consideration of contagious disease propagation risk","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate weighting of factors against primary cbe areas may result in misaligned development priorities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for transmission of contagious diseases among construction sector participants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in off-site construction may lead to a higher risk of contagious diseases transmission due to transportation of materials and workers from various locations","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased use of digital techniques and technologies in construction may facilitate the spread of misinformation and fake news related to contagious diseases","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid shelter construction and emergency constructions may lead to overcrowding and inadequate ventilation, increasing the risk of airborne contagious diseases transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
